intro: Alyxia oubatchensis, commonly known as the Oubatch's alyxia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with often milky sap. The plant typically features small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color. It is often found in shrubland or forest margins, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
